resources.string: An example app with the Taplytics Android SDK already integrated
Taplytics offers variables that can be modified from the Taplytics Dashboard.

Give it a try. If you have entered your API key in the Application class, you can make a new experiment on the Taplytics Dashboard. You should see this new variable there in the dynamic variables tab! Change it\'s value, and use the shake menu to switch variations. \n\n If you don\'t see it in the dashboard, create a variable by the same name!
With Taplytics, you can create blocks of code that run or do not run based on the variation!

Give it a try. If you have entered your API key in the Application class, you can make a new experiment on the Taplytics Dashboard. You should see this new code block there in the dynamic variables tab! Change whether or not it should run, then shake the phone to switch variations! When it runs, the button below should disappear. \n\n If you don\'t see it in the dashboard, create a variable by the same name!

With the SDK, you can pass Taplytics many kinds of user attributes, such as their email, id, gender, age, etc. 

You can also send custom data, such as "paid subscription", or any other json data. 
Modify and apply your experiments based on this data! 

This page has sent some basic information to your Taplytics panel, see for yourself!
Taplytics allows you to log unique events that happen within your app. \n\nEvents such as a purchase going through, social sharing, and simple button clicks can be tracked with one small function.
Give it a try, pressing the button will track a button press event, with the number of times its been pressed this session on this screen.
Taplytics allows you to A/B test your app without writing a single line of code using visual experiments.

Give it a try. On your Taplytics dashboard, click "add element to variation", and then click an element on the app. \n\nFrom the dashboard, edit the settings on the view, select that variation, and check out your updates live!
